availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Douglas Jones (Union County, laborer and soldier)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William H. Jones and Madeline Jones. Resident in Union County in 1850. Laborer in Union County in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private and corporal from August 14, 1862 to October 29, 1863. Served in the North Cumberland Battalion in the Kentucky State Militia as fist lieutenant from March 1, 1865 to August 28, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 485A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 190.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 777.
